Package org.openlca.core.results.providers

Interface ResultProvider

All Known Implementing Classes:
EagerResultProvider, LazyLibraryProvider, LazyResultProvider, SimpleResultProvider
public interface ResultProvider
Defines the general interface of a `ResultProvider`. The documentation is based on matrix algebra but this does not mean that an implementation has to be based on matrices. It just has to implement this protocol. A user of a `ResultProvider` should treat the returned values as live views on the data of the result provider and thus should **never** modify these values. Because of this, the default implementations in this interface often have copy-behaviour and it is often more efficient to overwrite them in a specific implementation.

  • Field Details

    • EMPTY_VECTOR

      static final double[] EMPTY_VECTOR

  • Method Details

    • techIndex

      TechIndex techIndex()
      The index $\mathit{Idx}_A$ of the technology matrix $\mathbf{A}$. It maps the process-product pairs (or process-waste pairs) $\mathit{P}$ of the product system to the respective $n$ rows and columns of $\mathbf{A}$. If the product system contains other product systems as sub-systems, these systems are handled like processes and are also mapped as pair with their quantitative reference flow to that index:

      $$ \mathit{Idx}_A: \mathit{P} \mapsto [0 \dots n-1] $$

    • flowIndex

      FlowIndex flowIndex()
      The row index $\mathit{Idx}_B$ of the intervention matrix $\mathbf{B}$. It maps the (elementary) flows $\mathit{F}$ of the processes in the product system to the $m$ rows of $\mathbf{B}$.

      $$ \mathit{Idx}_B: \mathit{F} \mapsto [0 \dots m-1] $$

    • impactIndex

      ImpactIndex impactIndex()
      The row index $\mathit{Idx}_C$ of the matrix with the characterization factors $\mathbf{C}$ (the impact matrix). It maps the impact categories $\mathit{C}$ to the $k$ rows of $\mathbf{C}$.

      $$ \mathit{Idx}_C: \mathit{C} \mapsto [0 \dots k-1] $$

    • hasFlows

      default boolean hasFlows()

    • hasImpacts

      default boolean hasImpacts()

    • hasCosts

      boolean hasCosts()

    • scalingVector

      double[] scalingVector()
      The scaling vector $\mathbf{s}$ which is calculated by solving the equation

      $$\mathbf{A} \ \mathbf{s} = \mathbf{f}$$

      where $\mathbf{A}$ is the technology matrix and $\mathbf{f}$ the final demand vector of the product system.

    • scalingFactorOf

      default double scalingFactorOf​(int product)
      Returns the scaling factor $s_j$ for product $j$ from the scaling vector $\mathbf{s}$:

      $$ s_j = \mathbf{s}[j] $$

    • totalRequirements

      default double[] totalRequirements()
      The total requirements of the products to fulfill the demand of the product system. As our technology matrix $\mathbf{A}$ is indexed symmetrically (means rows and columns refer to the same process-product pair) our product amounts are on the diagonal of the technology matrix $\mathbf{A}$ and the total requirements can be calculated by the following equation where $\mathbf{s}$ is the scaling vector ($\odot$ denotes element-wise multiplication):

      $$ \mathbf{t} = \text{diag}(\mathbf{A}) \odot \mathbf{s} $$

    • totalRequirementsOf

      default double totalRequirementsOf​(int product)

    • techColumnOf

      double[] techColumnOf​(int product)
      Get the unscaled column $j$ from the technology matrix $A$.

    • techValueOf

      default double techValueOf​(int row, int col)
      Get the unscaled value $a_{ij}$ from the technology matrix $A$.

    • scaledTechValueOf

      default double scaledTechValueOf​(int row, int col)
      Get the scaled value $s_j * a_{ij}$ of the technology matrix $A$. On the diagonal of $A$ these are the total requirements of the system.

    • solutionOfOne

      double[] solutionOfOne​(int product)
      Get the scaling vector of the product system for one unit of output (input) of product (waste flow) j. This is equivalent with the jth column of the inverse technology matrix $A^{-1}[:,j]$ in case of full in-memory matrices.

    • loopFactorOf

      double loopFactorOf​(int product)
      The loop factor $loop_j$ of a product $i$ is calculated via:

      $$ loop_j = \frac{1}{\mathbf{A}_{jj} \ \mathbf{A}^{-1}_{jj}} $$

      It is $1.0$ if the process of the product is not in a loop. Otherwise it describes ...

    • totalFactorOf

      default double totalFactorOf​(int product)

    • unscaledFlowsOf

      double[] unscaledFlowsOf​(int product)
      Get the unscaled column $j$ from the intervention matrix $B$.

    • unscaledFlowOf

      default double unscaledFlowOf​(int flow, int product)
      Get the unscaled value $b_{ij}$ from the intervention matrix $B$.

    • directFlowsOf

      default double[] directFlowsOf​(int product)
      Returns the direct flow results for the given product j. This is the scaled column j from the intervention matrix B calculated via s[j] * B[:, j].
      Parameters:
      product - the product index j >= 0 for which the direct flow results should be returned.

    • directFlowOf

      default double directFlowOf​(int flow, int product)
      Get the the direct result of the given flow and product related to the final demand of the system. This is basically the element $g_{ij}$ of the column-wise scaled intervention matrix $B$:

      $$ G = B \text{diag}(s) $$

    • totalFlowsOfOne

      double[] totalFlowsOfOne​(int product)
      Returns the total flow results (direct + upstream) related to one unit of the given product $j$ in the system. This is the respective column $j$ of the intensity matrix $M$:

      $$M = B * A^{-1}$$

    • totalFlowOfOne

      default double totalFlowOfOne​(int flow, int product)
      Returns the total result (direct + upstream) of the given flow related to one unit of the given product in the system.

    • totalFlowsOf

      default double[] totalFlowsOf​(int product)

    • totalFlowOf

      default double totalFlowOf​(int flow, int product)
      Returns the total flow result (direct + upstream) of the given flow and product related to the final demand of the system.

    • totalFlows

      double[] totalFlows()
      The inventory result $\mathbf{g}$ of the product system:

      $$\mathbf{g} = \mathbf{B} \ \mathbf{s}$$

      Where $\mathbf{B}$ is the intervention matrix and $\mathbf{s}$ the scaling vector. Note that inputs have negative values in this vector.

    • impactFactorsOf

      double[] impactFactorsOf​(int flow)
      Get the impact factors $c_m$ for the given flow $m$ which is the $m$th column of the impact matrix $C \in \mathbb{R}^{k \times m}$:

      $$ c_m = C[:, m] $$

    • impactFactorOf

      default double impactFactorOf​(int indicator, int flow)
      Get the impact factor $c_{km}$ for the given indicator $m$ and flow $m$ which is the respective entry in the impact matrix $C \in \mathbb{R}^{k \times m}$:

      $$ c_{km} = C[k, m] $$

    • flowImpactsOf

      default double[] flowImpactsOf​(int flow)
      A LCIA category * flow matrix that contains the direct contributions of the elementary flows to the LCIA result. This matrix can be calculated by column-wise scaling of the matrix with the characterization factors $\mathbf{C}$ with the inventory result $\mathbf{g}$:

      $$\mathbf{H} = \mathbf{C} \ \text{diag}(\mathbf{g})$$

    • flowImpactOf

      default double flowImpactOf​(int indicator, int flow)

    • directImpactsOf

      double[] directImpactsOf​(int product)
      A LCIA category * process-product matrix that contains the direct contributions of the processes to the LCIA result. This can be calculated by a matrix-matrix multiplication of the direct inventory contributions $\mathbf{G}$ with the matrix with the characterization factors $\mathbf{C}$:

      $$\mathbf{H} = \mathbf{C} \ \mathbf{G}$$

    • directImpactOf

      default double directImpactOf​(int indicator, int product)

    • totalImpactsOfOne

      double[] totalImpactsOfOne​(int product)

    • totalImpactOfOne

      default double totalImpactOfOne​(int indicator, int product)

    • totalImpactsOf

      default double[] totalImpactsOf​(int product)

    • totalImpactOf

      default double totalImpactOf​(int indicator, int product)

    • totalImpacts

      double[] totalImpacts()

    • directCostsOf

      double directCostsOf​(int product)
      Contains the direct contributions $\mathbf{k}_s$ of the process-product pairs to the total net-costs ($\odot$ denotes element-wise multiplication):

      $$\mathbf{k}_s = \mathbf{k} \odot \mathbf{s}$$

    • totalCostsOfOne

      double totalCostsOfOne​(int product)

    • totalCostsOf

      default double totalCostsOf​(int product)

    • totalCosts

      double totalCosts()

    • isEmpty

      default boolean isEmpty​(double[] values)
      Returns true if the given array is `null` or empty.

    • scaleInPlace

      default void scaleInPlace​(double[] values, double factor)
      Scales the given vector $\mathbf{v}$ by the given factor $f$ in place:

      $$ \mathbf{v} := \mathbf{v} \odot f $$

    • scale

      default double[] scale​(double[] values, double factor)
      Calculates a vector $\mathbf{w}$ by scaling the given vector $\mathbf{v}$ with the given factor $f$:

      $$ \mathbf{w} = \mathbf{v} \odot f $$

    • copy

      default double[] copy​(double[] values)
